did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle: Gifford family papers, 1811-1857.
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Twenty seven letters, most addressed to Rowland S. Gifford from relatives and friends discussing a cholera epidemic in Albany, family news, the annexation of Texas, the dissolution of the Union, winter shipping on canals, land speculation, farming and buying a farm. Also miscellaneous legal documents including deeds, affidavits and a receipt.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Two items, 1811-1857. Item 1 contains 26 letters addressed to Rowland S. Gifford covering years 1833-1857. one letter to Merritt J. Cornell from Rowland S. Gif ford, and 4 legal documents (see below). Most of the letters are addressed to Rowland S. Gifford from Henry and Carolin Jones regarding their search for a farm near their aunt and uncle, the Giffords. Others are Arom Merritt J. Cornell, [B.] Conant, Philander Gifford (Rowland's brother), Jesse and Irene Gifford (Irene is presumably Rowland's mother), and J.W. and Polly Pritt. Letters are from Chatham and North Chatham, Valatie, New York, Maiden Bridge, Wilton, and Phelps, all in New York State. Item two is a deed (1811) for Lot no. 53, part of Township no. 11 (Phelps, Ontario County), sold by Sir Johnstone to Robert Rhea. Annexation of Texas (#20), Civil War (#31).

did.unittitle: Rowland S. Gifford Letters
Bill of sale, March 13, 1833

scopecontent.p: Aaron C. Gifford and Sylvester W. Conant for sale of Conant's farm in Wilton, Saratoga County, N.Y. Witnessed by two others, one is Rowland S. Gifford.

did.unittitle: Deed, May 2, 1831.

scopecontent.p: William Baker to Rowland S. Gifford for part of Lot #11, Wilton, Saratoga County, N.Y.

did.unittitle: Statement, May 3, 1831

scopecontent.p: by Commissioner of Saratoga County that Anna, widow of William Baker, is legally able to sell her deceased husband's land.

did.unittitle: Irene Gifford (?) to Rowland, Cady, Betsey and Mahala. [April 1833].

scopecontent.p: Talk of cholera.

did.unittitle: Irene Gifford (?) to Mahala and Betsey. A ugust 17, 1834.

scopecontent.p: More cholera news.

did.unittitle: Irene Gifford (Chatham, N.Y.) to Rowland S. and Aaron C. Gifford. March 9, 1835.

scopecontent.p: Family news, health, etc.

did.unittitle: Jesse and Irene Gifford (North Chatham, N.Y.) to Rowland S. Gifford. August 28, 1835.

scopecontent.p: Bridge accident involving travelling family members.

did.unittitle: Merritt J. Cornell (Wilton, N.Y.) to Rowland S. Gifford. September 6, 1836.

scopecontent.p: Gifford family moves to Newark or Phelps area.

did.unittitle: Rowland S. Gifford (Phelps, N.Y.) to Merritt J. Cornell. October 26, 1836.

scopecontent.p: Copy of reply to previous letter.

did.unittitle: Merritt J. Cornell (Wilton, N.Y.) to Rowland S. Gifford. December 28 , 1836.

scopecontent.p: Reply to previous letter N.B. Letters #'s 8, 9, and 10 concern the sale, bond, and mortgage of Rowland S. Gifford's new home in Phelps. Merritt Cornell is transacting the business.

did.unittitle: Henry and Carolin Jones (Valatie, N.Y.) to Rowland S. Gifford. September 10, 1843.

scopecontent.p: Jones' plan to buy a farm near the Giffords in Phelps, and a trip to New York City.

did.unittitle: Henry and Carolin Jones (New York, N.Y.) to Rowland S. and Mahala Gifford. March 24, 1844.

scopecontent.p: News of the Jones' travels.

did.unittitle: Henry Jones (New York, N.Y.) to Rowland S. and Mahala Gifford. May 21, 1844.

scopecontent.p: Reply to a letter from the Giffords.

did.unittitle: [B.] Conant (Valatie, N.Y.) to Rowland S. Gifford. October 25, 1844.

scopecontent.p: Business and family news. #6028

did.unittitle: Henry Jones (New York, N.Y.) to Rowland S. and Mahala Gifford. February 24, 1845.

scopecontent.p: Requests that the Giffords send furniture and belongings.

did.unittitle: Carolin Jones (New York, N.Y.) to Rowland S. and Mahala Gifford. February [?], 1845.

scopecontent.p: Same as above.

did.unittitle: Henry Jones (New York, N.Y.) to Rowland S. Gifford. March 26, 1845.

scopecontent.p: More talk of furniture and moving plans.

did.unittitle: Philander S. Gifford (Chatham, N.Y.) to Rowland S. Gifford. August 10, 1845.

scopecontent.p: Almost entirely illegible. Talk of a dry season and poor crops.

did.unittitle: Jesse Gifford (Chatham, N.Y.) to Rowland S. Gifford. August 29, 1845.

scopecontent.p: Dry season; poor crops expected; stock expected to die due to lack of winter grains for feed.

did.unittitle: B. Conant (Valatie, N.Y.) to Rowland S. Gifford. November 18, 1844.

scopecontent.p: Mentions Polk and the proposed annexation of Texas, the implications for North and South.

did.unittitle: Henry and Carolin Jones (Valatie, N.Y.) to Rowland S. and Mahala Gifford. November l6, 1844.

scopecontent.p: Winter shipping on canals, moving to Nassau, looking for land.

did.unittitle: [B.] Conant (Valatie, N.Y.) to Rowland S. Gifford. December 26, 1845.

scopecontent.p: Re: payments, land speculation.

did.unittitle: [B.] Conant (Valatie, N.Y.) to Rowland S. Gifford. January 14, 1846.

scopecontent.p: Looking for a farm near Newark.

did.unittitle: Henry Jones (Valatie, N.Y.) to Rowland S. Gifford. January 2, 1846.

scopecontent.p: Shipping furniture on canals.

did.unittitle: Philander S. Gifford (Chatham, N.Y.) to Rowland S. Gifford. January 12, 1846.

scopecontent.p: Prices of grain, wheat, flour, oats, corn.

did.unittitle: [B.] Conant (Valatie, N.Y.) to Rowland S. Gifford. February 9, 1346.

scopecontent.p: Prices of land, the coming of the railroad.

did.unittitle: Affidavit. [n.d.]

scopecontent.p: Rowland S. Gifford released from serving jury duty because of deafness.

did.unittitle: Henry Jones (Newark, N.Y.) to Rowland S. and Mahala Gifford. August 14, 1849.

scopecontent.p: Carolin's death.

did.unittitle: Philander S. Gifford (Chatham, N.Y.) to Rowland S. Gifford. May 15, 1853.

scopecontent.p: World's Fair mentioned.

did.unittitle: Philander S. Gifford (Chatham, N.Y.) to Rowland S. Gifford. January 5, 1857

scopecontent.p: Asks for money.

did.unittitle: Polly Pritt (Maiden Bridge, N.Y.) to Rowland S. Gifford. n.d.

scopecontent.p: Discusses cholera in Albany, from J.W. Pritt mentions Martin Van Buren in New York; a political dispute over tariffs, dissolution of the Union; Henry Clay mentioned as the compromiser.
